author: Anonymous Scale
title: DrRacket: Interactions disabled; out of memory
question:
I was peacefully doing my lab but then DrRacket crashed so I peacefully waited for it to close before rebooting it again. This time when I tried to run my code, it gave me this message:
"The evaluation thread is no longer running, so no evaluation can take place until the next execution.
The program ran out of memory."
What does this mean? Peacefully asking, thanks
instructor_answer: This generally means that your program is infinitely looping. As you learn about the natural recursion, you'll learn about the base case that prevents this. Look for a portion of your program that makes a function call of the same function inside of its definition. If you're still in your lab, ask your TA right now for help.
